conversations.content: Are you in here, Heinwald?
I'm sorry to barge in, but we—
Salutations, Euden.
And you've brought your whole entourage. My, my. Well, if it's Heinwald you seek, you'll find him in his laboratory.
I'm gonna go ahead and ask for everybody: Why are you in Heinwald's manor?
Oh, sweet little Notte. You have the most adorable look of confusion right now, with just a hint of accusation.
Let us make a riddle of the answer, shall we? Why do YOU think I'm here? Go on, then. Give it your best shot.
Wait, we're doing riddle contests now? Oh man, okay. Uh...
I guess you always were a big fan of riddles, Akasha. Ha ha...ha?
Indeed. What finer labyrinth for the mind? What more tantalizing depth to plumb armed only with the sum of one's wits?
I do hope you'll partake of this one, dear prince. Why is it, do you think, that you have discovered me here?
Huh. Well, let me think...
You can think until smoke pours from your ears, but you'll never find the answer.
For this riddle—like most of those which come from Akasha's twisted mind— in fact has no answer.
Nice to see you, Heinwald. Oh, and I'm sorry for interrupting your work like this.
Not at all—guests with common sense are a pleasant change of pace. Why, you even deigned to come in through the door!
Did someone NOT use the door?
Yes, I fear I've been facing something of an invasion of late and haven't had a moment's peace.
Today included, as you no doubt noted.
And this invader of yours is...
Let the record show that I DO thank dear Heinwald for the hospitality every time I arrive. I'm not a total boor.
And I'm afraid you're mistaken on one count, Heinwald: My riddle does, in fact, have an answer.
As I've mentioned each passing day of late, I hope you'll take a closer look at my Halloween costume. ...MUCH closer.
Wait, are we still riddling here? I am VERY confused.
So, wait. You came over here to show Heinwald your Halloween costume?
My, my! Notte's guessed the answer! Here, you may have this treat as a prize.
Dude, it's a bat-shaped cookie! I'm totally horfin' this sucker down.
Bat cookies to match your vampire costume, is it? How delightful.
They both suit you splendidly, Akasha.
You are far too kind, and I am touched. Dear Heinwald, I fear, has been a touch more stingy with his praise.
Have I? I think it suits you well. You've captured a certain...ambiance.
An ambiance of something inhuman, but ambiance nevertheless.
That's quite the wicked little compliment.
It is not my intention to be clever. I'm simply giving my honest response.
Mmm, I see. Then I shall take it as a Heinwaldian compliment, sincerely given.
If that is what you wish to think, I'll not stop you.
Now then, Euden. I assume you needed something?
Yes, actually. I need your help with a certain matter. You see...
...Serial livestock exsanguination, is it? How very fascinating.
The first incident happened right around the start of Halloween.
A handful of local farmers complained  their goats and cattle were being drained of blood in the night.
Human footprints were found at the scene, so it appears to be a person doing it, but we don't have a clue who it might be.
Then, a few days ago, a human was attacked in the same manner, making the situation increasingly more dire.
How terrible. I hope the victim is all right?
They'll live—but so long as the perpetrator is at large, other people and livestock are going to be at risk.
That sounds quite dangerous, especially considering all the seasonal festivities.
Precisely. The locals here dress up in costumes to celebrate, which makes the region a destination for tourists.
All the new people has made it nearly impossible to track down a suspect—not to mention increasing the possible pool of victims.
Will you help us, Heinwald? I want to nip this in the bud as fast as possible.
A case of Halloween bloodsucking, eh...?
Why not offer your expertise? It does seem to be a case teeming with the sort of luscious mysteries you so enjoy.
Regretfully, I must decline on the grounds that your particular case does not interest me in the slightest.
So you're fine with people getting turned into flesh raisins?!
Worry not. This isn't the sort of case that comes with a body count.
You speak as though you've already solved it. ...Have you?
It's a meager specimen, as mysteries go— to the point that I'd tell you it's safe to simply ignore it entirely.
How can you say that when people have already suffered real harm?
I see no issue. Once Halloween is over, the matter will disappear on its own.
Now, why don't you all get dressed up and enjoy the festivities?
*sigh* You really are quite cold at times. These people are asking for your help.
Well then, if Heinwald is unwilling to lend himself to the matter, perhaps I might help you in his stead.
You?
Indeed. Mysteries are within my bailiwick as well, so I may be of at least some use.
I, for one, would welcome your advice.
We'll take all the help we can get if you're willing to lend it.
But of course. Allow me to join you in Heinwald's place as we suss out the truth.
To listen to someone more uncanny than a vampire talk of rooting out the truth... Hah! Thank goodness THAT particular storm finally blew itself out of here.
I can only imagine what is to follow. At the very least, it should make for an entertaining show...
Let us waste no time in beginning our investigation. We must discover where our serial bloodsucker lurks.
I'm afraid we haven't a single clue so far.
Surely you're not without at least SOME information?
Just the reports of those harmed in the incidents so far.
They all claim the perpetrator was dressed as a vampire.
A Halloween costume, then?
Yes, though it's unclear why they would go to the effort.
Unless it isn't a costume at all.
Ha ha ha! Gimme a break, lady. Vampires only exist in spooky stories.
Heh heh. I suppose you have me there. Thankfully, I have another theory...
The perpetrator is a human who wishes to be SEEN as a vampire.
I'm all for folks flying their freak flag, but are vampire wannabes even a thing?
The world is full of people who desire to be different from everyone else—and to be both feared and respected.
It would scarce surprise me to find someone yearning to become a fearsome and spectacular beast of legend.
The desire to change oneself is common enough, but you think this person actually wants to incite fear?
If that's the case, they're likely to act out in ever more extreme ways in the future.
We have to find them before they put someone at real risk.
Sooooo what's the plan? We wander around looking for somebody dressed up with their teeth hangin' out?
I propose a simpler solution: Let us encourage the perpetrator to show themselves willingly.
I don't think Dr. Bitey's just gonna accept an invitation, Akasha.
Then perhaps this calls for a devilish little trick. Heh heh heh...
Uhhh...
Later that night...
Barely made it in time for Halloween, but we're finally here!
Good thing, too! This is the only time'a year we make coin sellin' rotted pumpkins!
Plus I've always wanted to see everybody dressed up in costumes like they do here.
Good evening, my fine merchants.
Hot pot of coffee, look at this welcoming committee! I TOLD ya Alberia is the best! They sent a dame in a vampire costume!
Whatever do you mean, my dear? This is no costume.
Uh, buddy? Maybe we oughta steer clear of this gal? She's kinda creepin' me out...
Mmm, what a wild imagination you have. Now won't you join me for the evening's revels?
Ugh... I can't sleep.
Is that a lullaby?
It's kinda...nice...
Poor, sleepless little lamb. I'll gladly cuddle until you fall into a deep and soundless slumber...
Are you a...a vampire? You feel so... so warm and cozy...
Heh heh heh...
I'm afraid we're getting more and more reports of townspeople saying they've seen a vampire, Euden.
Sounds like our perp is on the move!
Er, no. It's not that. Um...
Eyyy, Akasha! Lookin' gorgeous as always! Come sink those chompers in my neck!
No! Bite me first!
No, me!
For heaven's sake, show some decorum! ...Also, I'M first!
I'm a little scared, but if it's Akasha doing the biting, then...
You're looking more radiant than ever, my dear vampire lady...
Heh heh. No need to fight over me, darlings. Form a line and I'll see to each and every one of you in turn.
Ahhh...
...So yes, I'm afraid Akasha managed to seduce the entire town.
In a single night? Just what did she do?
It's like she's a real vampire! Ha ha ha!
Mind your words, Notte, or you're liable to make the actual vampires jealous.
...Like that one, for example.
Muh?
Pah! ＂Real vampire,＂ my foot...
Hey, yeah! That guy was mixed in with the crowd, but he wasn't swooning over Akasha like all the rest.
Quite the opposite, in fact—he seemed rather displeased by the whole scene.
Almost as if he didn't take kindly to me being called a vampire and being made the center of attention.
Ah! Then that was—
Mmm. Our perpetrator is attempting to use the guise of a vampire to stand out.
Surely such a person would find another vampire stealing their limelight to be unwelcome in the extreme.
Perhaps even enough for them to emerge from hiding so they might size up the competition firsthand.
Dude, look at the big brain on YOU! So boyo over there is our guy, then?
It's too early to be certain, but it seems a lead worthy of following.
Pretty impressive stuff, Akasha. Let's follow him!
Looks like our guy went into that house. What's our next move?
Perhaps we can avail ourselves of a peep through that window.
Well? Can you see anything?
Nothing weird, really... Hey, wait, there's something written on the floor.
It is a magic sigil, drawn in blood.
BLOOD?! Oh man, total creepshow.
It must have required a fair amount of blood to paint all... Oh!
The exsanguination incidents. I think it's time for us to have a chat with this particular fellow.
I'll go to the front door—you guys watch the windows and back to make sure he doesn't slip away.
Right!
Akasha? Is something wrong?
I am struck by one minor point of concern, Euden.
If possible, I should like to research the matter straight away. Might I leave this scene to you for the moment?
What has you concerned?
A small matter involving the sigil that I hope is naught but idle worry.
However, if my fears prove true, this becomes a somewhat more vexing case. I feel it would be best to know before proceeding further.
In that case, go ahead. We'll rendezvous as soon as we secure the suspect.
Much appreciated. Farewell for now.
All right, time to catch our mark.
We'll hear what he has to say for himself, then check in with Akasha.
...Then you admit to it? You made the sigil and drained all the blood?
Yes! All was done so I might see this sigil completed!
What does it DO, exactly? The energy it gives off is exceptionally unpleasant...
It grants my wish!
It is the key to eternal life!
An immortality spell?!
Of a sort. To be more specific, it's a summoning circle for a particular fiend.
If I can bind it to my will and share its power, I will never grow old! Never die! ...Or that was the plan, at least.
I am not fond of the ＂was＂ portion in that particular sentence. Did the spell fail?
Oh, the spell worked like a charm—but the moment the thing appeared, it took off without so much as a look back!
But I won't be humiliated like this! I'm going to track that thing down, and when I do, I'll—
Right! Okay, then. I think we understand what's going on now. I take it you have some way to find this thing?
Would I be standing here if I did?! I heard rumors earlier, but that turned out to just be some woman in a costume that people were fawning over.
Akasha, I presume.
Which explains how irritated you were when you saw her and realized she wasn't the creature you were looking for.
So you're NOT a vampire wannabe.
But why bother with the costume and trappings of a vampire in that case?
Costume? What are you talking about?
Don't try to muddy the waters now. The victims all reported that their assailant wore a costume.
And who told you that? The cows? 'Cause I haven't attacked any people.
Wait, wait, wait. What's going on here? If HE didn't attack them, then who did?
You know, this reminds me of a story about a certain creature...
Hey, yeah! Didn't you read me a story about an immortal monster thingie once?
An immortal monster that seduced victims, drank their blood, and turned them into one of its own kind.
Stop. You're not actually suggesting that—
That those villagers weren't attacked by a person in a costume? Yes, Cleo. That's exactly what I'm suggesting.
It was a REAL vampire!
Oh, I get it nowwwWHAAAAAAAT?!
(If memory serves, that sigil is the forbidden vampiric summoning circle.)
(The source is indistinct, but I sense otherworldly mana, which means the creature is most certainly here.)
But where, exactly, is—
Good evening, madam.
Ah, but your beauty is captivating.
We've handed the perpetrator off to the town guard. Well done, all.
Now to meet back up with Akasha and track down that vampire.
Knowing her, Akasha will have predicted all of this and taken action accordingly.
Her research may already have turned up something useful. Let's hurry back to her.
Yeah, before things get ugly. Er, well, ugliER, I guess.
Nnngh... This is...inside the castle? No, not the Halidom.
I trust you slept well, my beautiful guest?
No, the word ＂guest＂ does you disservice, for tonight, you are my bride!
Ah, I see. This is your illusion, then; a castle within a dream.
Is it not to your liking? But say the word, and I will provide any backdrop you desire.
Well? What would you ask of me?
My, what a lovely bit of spellcraft. It is EVER so fascinating...
Is that so? Then perhaps you will cede your body unto me and make an offering of your blood.
Believe me, a far more delicious dream awaits you on the other side.
And might that dream be the glamour your kind casts upon their prey when they dine on human blood?
I've read how no greater pleasure exists. Rather a shame that all who taste it lose their lives in the process.
Your beauty is matched only by your wits. Truly, you are a prime specimen!
To merely take your blood would be a crime without measure. No, you must share MY blood—and my unending life along with it!
Unending life, you say?
The very thing countless humans have sought for in vain. Eternal life—eternal BEAUTY! Have you truly never hungered for such?
Heh heh heh heh...
Do I amuse you, dear?
Ah, forgive me. I'm simply tickled to meet a vampire who is so very...VAMPIRE-Y.
Why, I'm fit to burst with joy!
I do not understand.
To think I would make your acquaintance on this of all nights...
I couldn't ask for a more perfect fit for Halloween, that time of strange costumes, song and dance, and tricks or treats.
Oh yes. You will be the perfect sacrifice.
You...you are not human. But then, what ARE you?
What am I indeed! Oh, I know: Let's make a riddle of the answer.
What do you THINK I am? Go on, now...
Have. A. Think.
S-stay back! This dream is a world of MY creation, and if anything happens to me, your consciousness will share my fate!
Oh, that's VERY sweet—but you needn't worry your pretty head about me, dear.
Now, I know you vampires enjoy the dark, so I think I have just the spot...
Ah, yes. Here we are! A fitting prison to hold my lovely new sacrifice.
My illusion...shattered? But how?! How is this POSSIBLE?!
Hush, dear. No cause for fear. Tonight is Halloween, so let's enjoy the evening together, you and I.
Now...trick or treat. ♪
Stay back... STAY BAAAACK!
Oh dear. It looks like someone didn't bring any candy with them.
In that case, I don't suppose you can complain when you get tricked, mmm?
No no no no no NO NO NOOOOO!
My master beckons...
Slake his hunger.
Akashaaaa? ...AKASHAAAAAA!
Answer if you can hear us!
...I am here.
Akasha! You're inside this house?!
I fear the vampire took me by surprise.
Hold on. I'll break down the door!
Are you all right, Akasha?!
Perfectly fine, thank you. When I fought back, the vampire turned tail and fled back to his own world.
Wait, so you chased a vampire out of this entire material plane by YOURSELF?!
Indeed I did. I'm quite strong, you know.
Though I am very glad to see you safe, I wish you had not been so reckless.
Me too. But with the vampire gone and the man who summoned him arrested, I suppose we can put this behind us.
Yes, that would seem to resolve the matter.
Well, chasing a vampire off sounds like pretty tiring work, so let's get back to the Halidom and let you rest.
A capital idea.
...ooOOOOooo...
Uhhh...?
Something the matter, Notte?
Did you not...hear that? Just now?
Hear what, dear?
My ears must be crammed full of candy or something, because I could swear...
It has been a long day of running about for all of us, so what say I bring some leftover cookies along as a post-dinner treat?
Seriously? Score!
...o...oooOOOOooo... Heeeelp...meee....
*gasp* *pant* C-can anyone hear me?! Help! Get me out of here!
Aah?! Wh-what was that?!
Where IS this place? There's nothing here! Nothing...anywhere...
Just an endless void...of nothing...
Ah.
Aaaaaaah! It's coming! Something comes!
GYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARGH!
Man, this rules. Why don't we get cookies after EVERY mission?!
They ARE delicious. Thank you, Akasha.
Please, think nothing of it.
It's not just the cookies: You lured the perpetrator out AND chased the vampire away single-handedly.
You've done us all a great service, and I hope you will accept this with our thanks.
Oh? This is...
A pumpkin pie. We all helped make it.
Actually, Cleo did all the difficult work, but I at least scooped out pumpkin goo.
And I put all the pretty flowers on top! Their nectar's super sweet, so make like a vampire and suck 'em all dry!
Heh. You are all far too kind. I shall enjoy this treat throughout the season.
Yeah, let's enjoy what's left of the holiday together, Akasha!
Of course, my dear Notte.
*sigh* Entering uninvited yet again?
Oh, but I did thank you for your hospitality when I entered.
I heard nothing of the sort—though what I DID hear is a rumor that you managed to crack that case most brilliantly.
My, but word travels fast here.
Quite. A certain inquisitor enjoying his Halloween babysitting told me of it. Apparently, you're the talk of the town.
Shame it's all a farce.
Whatever do you mean?
For starters, there's the fellow who supposedly summoned the fiend.
I'm told the fool has only the most rudimentary grasp of magic.
Quite the feat for an ignoramus to summon a high-level being from another world.
Indeed it would be. Are you implying he had an accomplice?
I'm implying the incident was a farce, but yes, that has something to do with it.
After all, the one who taught him that sigil stands before me now.
But even given the knowledge, otherworld summonings are a rather laborious affair. So much preparation and hassle.
For someone trying to enjoy her Halloween like you, it must have been convenient to find a man willing to do all the busy work.
Don't be silly. I'd never met that man in my life, as the others will all attest to.
You needn't have met. Simply drawing the correct magical sigil into the sorry facsimile of a grimoire he was using would suffice.
Ah... Yes, that would certainly be possible. But the vampire DID abduct me and nearly drain me dry.
Yet here you stand, still firmly in possession of every last drop.
Oh, but you are simply a MARVEL!
Stop. I'll blush.
As to motive, I suppose you wanted a suitably mischievous sacrifice to offer up on this most dark of days.
The uncanny revels of a costumed crowd are just the sort of tacky affair your master would go ga-ga over.
And yet, one glaring hole remains in your otherwise airtight logic.
Oh, do go on.
Had I really orchestrated a summoning and chosen to loose a vampire on the town, a single slip would have meant the deaths of any number of human victims.
Yet the other day, you yourself dismissed this case as ＂not the sort that comes with a body count.＂
Just what gave you the confidence to make such an assertion?
Ah. That. Well, with you pulling the strings behind the scenes, I knew you'd intervene if and when the time came.
And so you did. You used yourself as bait to prevent the fiend from killing humans.
An easy claim to make after the fact. But what cause would I have to do such a thing?
Because you were enjoying Halloween.
A creature of pleasures such as yourself would never dream of ruining an event that you found fun.
...... I'm...enjoying Halloween...
Pfft. Aaaaah ha ha ha!
My, my. It seems I've fallen for the biggest trick of the season.
And? Did you enjoy it?
Oh, yes. Thoroughly.
